availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dulaney Richardson Carr (1st Kentucky Cavalry Regimen, attorney)

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and attorney. Tennessee native. Son of Thomas Carr and Sarah Ann Carr. Farmer in Clinton County in 1860. Sergeant, second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from July 27, 1861, to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 10-11.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, p. 51.
